thread.title: Spared from rampage, but not its horror
thread.title_full: Spared from rampage, but not its horror - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Spared from rampage, but not its horror
text:
BINGHAMTON , N.Y. - It was too much for Angela Leach to bear: Her day off from work had mutated into a heartbreaking day of mourning for a co-worker and 12 immigrant students.
The silver-haired volunteer president of the American Civic Association , where a gunman killed 13 people and himself, spoke in a voice choked with emotion Saturday, struggling to make sense of the nightmare at a place bent on fostering dreams.
"That this tragedy should have happened in our community... is unbearable," Leach said, struggling through a prepared statement. "We are stricken with grief."
Leach spoke with an unsteady voice one day after news of the shootings in her building had left her weeping at her home.
The overwrought woman declined to take questions, nearly breaking down before finishing her remarks.
Her decision to take a three-day weekend rather than stop by the building on Front St. in Binghamton had kept her alive - and left her searching for answers.
"Whatever drove this individual to do what he did, I cannot possibly fathom," she said.
